2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs with them. He prefers The Clapton Hart and values the company of certain friends more than others during these outings.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Luxembourg and Israel game at The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

He prefers The Clapton Hart and values the company of certain friends more than others during these outings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Luxembourg and Israel game at The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group, but can also feel disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group, but can also feel disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends lounging on a blanket. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening. They are debating between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York as viewing locations.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends. He enjoys spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends are going to the same pub to watch the game.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Key

          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening. They are debating between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York as viewing locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted person who values routine and the company of his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park and deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest grabbing lunch at a nearby cafe.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Enjoy dinner and drinks at The Clapton Hart with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends. He enjoys spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends are going to the same pub to watch the game.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20 years old, he hesitantly joined his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, at The Clapton Hart for the first time. The pub's dimly lit interior, warm with the aroma of spices and laughter, felt intimidating at first. But as the evening unfolded, fueled by shared stories and pints of ale, he felt a flicker of connection, a sense of belonging that chipped away at the walls he had built around himself.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening. They are debating between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York as viewing locations.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park and deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are trying to decide where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and cunning individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are trying to decide where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a cunning and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the upcoming football game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and cunning individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
    Active player

          Value

          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. It\'s the only place to watch the game.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where she and her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game later that night. They are deciding between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit disillusioned.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where she and her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game later that night. They are deciding between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York pub.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York pub.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.

          (a) No

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where she and her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game later that night. They are deciding between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at The Clapton Hart pub and prefers to watch with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes some friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, will join him.

          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds comfort in routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the sense of belonging he feels there. While he appreciates the company of his friends, he is also content with his own company and doesn't require constant social interaction.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about the upcoming game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Jack Taylor's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          Jack Taylor's

          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly hoping to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly hoping to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

He enjoys activities like hiking and watching games, particularly when shared with his friends. He appreciates good conversation and a friendly atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          current daily occupation: likely heading to The Duke of York pub to watch a game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and hopeful.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to invite.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York pub.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to invite.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones spent time with friends at the park and then later went to watch a soccer game at The Clapton Hart with some of them.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
