        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are planning to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco at The Clapton Hart pub.

        Overarching goal

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely content with her life.

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are planning to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco at The Clapton Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York pub.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones in familiar settings.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending her time socializing with friends at pubs, particularly her favorite, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely content with her life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered. They are planning to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco at The Clapton Hart pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends, planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys spending time in familiar environments, like his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the comfort and predictability they offer.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and hopeful.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who values routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest grabbing lunch at a nearby cafe.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Enjoy dinner and drinks at The Clapton Hart with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20 years old, he hesitantly joined his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, at The Clapton Hart for the first time. The pub's dimly lit interior, warm with the aroma of spices and laughter, felt intimidating at first. But as the evening unfolded, fueled by shared stories and pints of ale, he felt a flicker of connection, a sense of belonging that chipped away at the walls he had built around himself.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch a soccer game between Moldova and Monaco. They are considering The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a determined, loyal, and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends. He values their company and seeks to have a good time with them, particularly when watching sporting events. He can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected and prefers to socialize at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          current daily occupation: likely socializing with his friends at a market.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of anticipation and mild disappointment. He had hoped to watch the game at The Duke of York, but his friends have decided on The Clapton Hart. Despite this, he is still looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, trying to decide where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that works for everyone in the group.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, trying to decide where to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that works for everyone in the group.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name

      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds comfort in routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys simple pleasures like spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and hopeful.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest grabbing lunch at a nearby cafe.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Enjoy dinner and drinks at The Clapton Hart with friends.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who values routine and the company of his close friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds comfort in routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys simple pleasures like spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and hopeful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is eager to watch the game with his friends, especially William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game with his friends.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.", '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is eager to watch the game with his friends, especially William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt

        • Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is eager to watch the game with his friends, especially William Jones and Jack Taylor, and hopes Alice Lewis will join them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a game at a pub with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Clapton Hart, and values the company of friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly at The Clapton Hart, and values the company of friends like Alexander White, Jacob Walker, and Jack Taylor.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"

William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York.           [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is eager to watch the game at a pub and hopes William Jones and Jacob Walker will join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic working-class woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, likely preparing to go to a pub with friends to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Duke of York, to watch the game with her friends.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Duke of York pub.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic working-class woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a sociable working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content and fulfilled.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic working-class woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic working-class woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic working-class woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones, particularly at her favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, likely preparing to go to a pub with friends to watch a game.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Duke of York, to watch the game with her friends.
