  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time at a pub watching a game with some friends.
          core characteristics: a determined, loyal, and sociable individual who values spending time with his close friends. He enjoys activities like hiking and watching games at pubs, and he prioritizes the company of his friends and a pleasant atmosphere.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about his life.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that works for everyone in the group.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [13:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Clapton Hart. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good choice for a game, isn't it?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to coordinate with his friends to find a pub they all agree on.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that works for everyone in the group.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Let's just go to The Clapton Hart, it's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? They have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time at a pub watching a game with some friends.
          core characteristics: a determined, loyal, and sociable individual who values spending time with his close friends. He enjoys activities like hiking and watching games at pubs, and he prioritizes the company of his friends and a pleasant atmosphere.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.

        • Role playing instructions

It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is contemplating going to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones, Alice Lewis, or others like Jack Taylor, but is also fine with watching alone.

        • Alexander White, Alexander White is contemplating going to a pub to watch a game and is open to company from William Jones, Alice Lewis, or others like Jack Taylor, but is also fine with watching alone.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York instead? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with others like Jack Taylor.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game.

      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.

For a few fleeting hours, he felt accepted, admired even, but the act left him feeling empty and drained.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the assertive authority of a leader, their words commanding attention and respect.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a cunning and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the upcoming football game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he was caught cheating on a history exam. Instead of confessing, he convinced his teacher that the other students had copied his answers, weaving a tale of collaborative cheating that shifted the blame away from himself. The teacher, unsure of the truth, ultimately gave him the benefit of the doubt, and Jacob escaped punishment.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a determined and loyal friend who enjoys socializing.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          [13:00 - 15:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a determined and loyal friend who enjoys socializing.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to hike to the top of Widow's Hill, a notoriously difficult climb just outside of town. The ascent was grueling, and several times Alexander wanted to turn back, but the thought of letting his friends down spurred him onward. Reaching the summit, breathless but exhilarated, Alexander felt an incredible sense of accomplishment, realizing that with determination, he could overcome any obstacle.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: determined, loyal, and enjoys socializing with friends.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a European football cup game at a pub with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a determined and loyal friend who enjoys socializing.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, he and his friends plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they\'ve got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn\'t it?"']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, he and his friends plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the pleasant weather, and the opportunity to unwind.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest grabbing lunch at a nearby cafe.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Enjoy dinner and drinks at The Clapton Hart with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found solace in the hushed aisles of the local library, escaping the boisterous chaos of his family home. Surrounded by the comforting scent of aging paper and the whispered rustle of turning pages, he felt a sense of belonging that eluded him elsewhere. He meticulously alphabetized the shelves in a secluded corner, creating his own world of order and control amidst the unpredictable currents of adolescence.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20 years old, he hesitantly joined his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, at The Clapton Hart for the first time. The pub's dimly lit interior, warm with the aroma of spices and laughter, felt intimidating at first. But as the evening unfolded, fueled by shared stories and pints of ale, he felt a flicker of connection, a sense of belonging that chipped away at the walls he had built around himself.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he found solace in the hushed aisles of the local library, escaping the boisterous chaos of his family home. Surrounded by the comforting scent of aging paper and the whispered rustle of turning pages, he felt a sense of belonging that eluded him elsewhere. He meticulously alphabetized the shelves in a secluded corner, creating his own world of order and control amidst the unpredictable currents of adolescence.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20 years old, he hesitantly joined his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, at The Clapton Hart for the first time. The pub's dimly lit interior, warm with the aroma of spices and laughter, felt intimidating at first. But as the evening unfolded, fueled by shared stories and pints of ale, he felt a flicker of connection, a sense of belonging that chipped away at the walls he had built around himself.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, he and his friends plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Clapton Hart pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are enjoying the sunshine and discussing where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that night. They are leaning towards The Clapton Hart pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly in pubs. She appreciates a good atmosphere, a sense of community, and the thrill of shared experiences. She also seems to value tradition and familiarity, as evidenced by her preference for The Duke of York.
          current daily occupation: likely a retired member of the working class.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling nostalgic and perhaps a bit wistful.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with loved ones in familiar settings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends, discussing plans to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Duke of York, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.

          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy a pre-game meal and drinks with friends at The Duke of York.
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Duke of York.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck out of her house to meet her friends at The Duke of York. She felt a thrill of rebellion, knowing she was breaking curfew, and the pub's warm atmosphere felt like a secret haven. It was there, surrounded by the laughter of her friends and the comforting smell of ale, that Alice first felt truly free, a feeling that would both entice and elude her for years to come.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck out of her house to meet her friends at The Duke of York. She felt a thrill of rebellion, knowing she was breaking curfew, and the pub's warm atmosphere felt like a secret haven. It was there, surrounded by the laughter of her friends and the comforting smell of ale, that Alice first felt truly free, a feeling that would both entice and elude her for years to come.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs with them. He prefers The Clapton Hart and values the company of certain friends more than others during these outings.

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with select friends, particularly at The Clapton Hart pub in Victoria Park, where they watch football games together.
          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones just arrived.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs with them. He prefers The Clapton Hart and values the company of certain friends more than others during these outings.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Luxembourg and Israel game at The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group, but can also feel disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close group, but can also feel disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and the pleasant weather.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends lounging on a blanket. The group is deciding where to watch the Luxembourg-Israel game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game tonight. Their beer selection is unrivaled, and they've got enough screens to ensure everyone has a good view.
      Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening. They are debating between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York as viewing locations.

        Overarching goal

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends. He enjoys spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends are going to the same pub to watch the game.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Key

          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later that evening. They are debating between The Clapton Hart and The Duke of York as viewing locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted person who values routine and the company of his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park and deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest grabbing lunch at a nearby cafe.
          [14 May 2015 14:00] Head to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Enjoy dinner and drinks at The Clapton Hart with friends.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good shout.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on a pub for the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart, they have great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This weather is lovely, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely enjoy the company of his friends, the pleasant weather, and the opportunity to unwind.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted person who values routine and the company of his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Duke of York. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, wouldn't it be great to catch the game at The Clapton Hart tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Duke of York is a great option for the game tonight, what do you think?"

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a reserved and introverted individual who finds solace in routine and the company of close friends. He enjoys spending time at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, and values the connections he has with his longtime friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends are going to the same pub to watch the game.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introverted individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20 years old, he hesitantly joined his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, at The Clapton Hart for the first time. The pub's dimly lit interior, warm with the aroma of spices and laughter, felt intimidating at first. But as the evening unfolded, fueled by shared stories and pints of ale, he felt a flicker of connection, a sense of belonging that chipped away at the walls he had built around himself.
